newsitem.title: CHINA: HAINAN AIRLINES PLANS NEW CHINA ROUTES.
newsitem.headline: HAINAN AIRLINES PLANS NEW CHINA ROUTES.

text.p: China's Hainan Airlines Co, which recently listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange, plans to add three new domestic routes after taking delivery of new aircraft, the Shanghai Securities News said on Saturday.
The airline on Friday took delivery of two Metro-23 aircraft, which were manufactured by Fairchild Dornier Corp, the newspaper said.
Hainan Airlines said in July it planned to buy seven, 18-seat Metro-23 aircraft worth a total of $30 million to be delivered in the second half of 1997.
With the delivery of the two new passenger jets, the airline's fleet now totalled 15 aircraft, the newspaper said.
The company would use the aircraft to fly routes between Haikou and Nanning, Haikou, Beihai and Liuzhou and Zhanjiang and Sanya, it said.
The new routes will link the airline's home base of southern Hainan province to the neighbouring provinces of Guangxi and Guangdong.
Hainan Airlines currently flies 40 routes, the company said in its prospectus. The carrier, which is linked to financier George Soros, in June listed 71 million foreign currency B shares in Shanghai.
